intro: Hedycrea incana, commonly known as the white-haired hedycrea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
